tagDescription: Newspaper Extract - New Orleans - Editorial Re. Report of the Treasurer regarding the debt of the State.
Journal of Commerce, Extract - Article re Annexation of Texas. (Taken from 30/6/1845 O. Corr.)
Louisiana Sessional Paper - No. 72. An Act to revise and amend the several acts of the Legislature connected with an adjustment of the debt proper of the State. (Taken from 3/3/1845 Corr. E.J.F.)
Harrisburg Correspondence Bill authorizing the Auditor General to settle with those who may have been indebted to the Commonwealth two years or upward, &c.
Newspaper Extract - Report of the Finance Committee of the Board of Aldermon and Common Council of the City of Mobile. (Taken from 8/3/1842 M. Corr.)
Louisiana - An Act to facilitate the Liquidation of the Property Banks chartered by this State.
Newspaper Extract - State Credit of Pennsylvania-Signed/ A Pennsylvanian. (Taken from 31/5/1845 Corr. G.M. & Co.)
Newspaper Extract - The Ohio Loan. (Taken from 14/5/1843 O. Corr.)
Statement of the Affairs of the Bank of Commerce in New York.
Newspaper Extract - Banks of Ohio pay Specie - An Act to provide for the liabilities of the State &c. Sgd/ C. - other correspondence on same subjects.
Newspaper Extract - Article on Maryland Finances, in reply to Mr. Johnson Sgd/ John L. Carey. (Taken from 5/4/1844 O. Corr.)
Newspaper Extract - Letter addressed to the Stockholders of the Union Bank of Louisiana. Sgd/ A Country Stockholder (Jos. Saul see Letter in which the extract was enclosed).
Circular of the Commissioners of the Ohio Canal Fund to the Stockholders of the State. Sgd/ E.W. Hubbard, Acting Commissioner Ohio Canal Fund. John Brough, State Auditor.
Newspaper Extract - Further letter from John L. Carey to this constituents in reply to Mr. Johnson's letter of 23/3.
An Act to provide for paying the debt and preserving the credit of New York State.
New York Star - Reprint of article from The Courier and Enquirer on Bank of United States. (Taken from 23/12/1839 O.)
Boston Daily Advertiser and Patriot - Extract - Article on The Present and Prospective Financial condition of the Country. Sgd/ Mercator. (Taken from 2/4/1842 O.)
Comparative Receipts of Cotton - New Orleans.

Louisiana - Report of the Committee on Finance to whom was referred so much of the Governor's Message as relates to the Finances of the State, the Treasurer's Report &c. Sgd/ Ben. Winchester, Chairman.
The Weekly Herald Commercial Record - Money Market. N.B. - Comprehensive & interesting.
Newspaper Extract - Re. Depression caused by failure of Erie Railroad - Example, Merchants' Exchange Co.
A Bill to grant to the [Great Western Railway Co.] State of Illinois a right of way through the public lands of the United States.
Newspaper Extract - Letter from New Orleans, unsigned - Re. financial affairs of the several municipalities of the City.
Newspaper Extract - Maryland - State Stocks.
Newspaper Extract - Money & Stocks - Reported for the Philadelphia Gazette - Sales at the Stock Board. (Taken from 14/5/1843 O.)
Newspaper Extract - Letter to Governor Porter in reply to letter of 16th instant, on subject of Banks. Sgd/ Truth (Taken from 27/2/1841 O.)
Circular Letter - Sgd/ Baring Brothers & Co. submitting Statement of the Assets and Liabilities of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
Circular - Ohio Statistics - Sgd/ Jos. S. Lake N.H. Swayne Alfred Kelley Commissioners Ohio Canal Fund
Newspaper Extract - United States Bank. Fourth and Fifth Letters from Nicholas Biddle Esq. to Hon. John M. Clayton.
United States Gazette - an Act to authorize the Governor to incorporate the Pennsylvania Canal and Railroad Company from Philadelphia to Pittsburg.
Newspaper Extract - Loans made by Ohio Canal Commissioners.
Advertiser and Patriot, Boston - Extract - Editorial re proceedings of Legislature of Maryland.
Newspaper Extract Re. Ohio State Bonds held by Baring Brothers. & Co. Letter sgd/ Wm. S. Hatch.
Newspaper Extract - Translation of an Article on the Union Bank of Louisiana. Sgd/ A. Sufferer.
Printed Report of a Committee of the Merchants' Exchange Co. (Enclosure No. 2.) (Taken from 24/5/1843 Corr. P.W. & k. 1842-6.)
Louisiana - An Act to provide for the adjustment and liquidation of Debts proper of the State, and for other purposes. (Duplicate See 25/3/1844).
New York Commercial Advertiser - Extract - Editorial - Suspension of Specie Payments.
Newspaper Extract - Boston - Meeting of the Stockholders of the Western Rail Road - Remarks of the Treasurer, Mr. Quincy (Taken from 31/1/1842 M. Corr.)
Newspaper Extract - Alabama State Debt. (Taken from 6/3/1843 M. Corr.)
Circular - Texas Loan - Sgd/ J. Hamilton, A.T. Burnley, Commissioners of Republic of Texas.
Pamphlet - Extract of a Letter from Edmund J. Forstall, Relative to the organization of the Citizens' Bank of Louisiana, dated, Amsterdam 24/12/1840.
Newspaper Extract - New Orleans - Editorial - Discusses the work before the Legislature in the closing week of the session.
Pamphlet - A Collection of Tables of the Imports, Exports, Home Consumption, and Prices of Cotton for a series of years. (Joseph Armstrong, Manchester)
Newspaper Clipping: Extract from the speech of the treasurer of Maryland.
Newspaper Extract - Bank of United States Affairs.
Newspaper Extract - Report of the Directors of the Bank of the United States. (Taken from 13/1/1841 O.)

Newspaper Extract - Maryland House of Delegates - Remarks by Mr. Carey on the resolution from the Committee of Ways and Means directing the Treasurers to sell certain coupons in the Treasury and to invest the proceeds in State Bonds.
The Senate, State of New York - Report of the Committee on finance, on various reports referred, of the State Officers.
New York Courier & Enquirer 31/3/1840 - Bank of the United States.
Circular, Canton, Sgd/ Nye, Parkin & Co.
The Age, New Orleans, Extracts - Editorial - Governor Mouton - Letter addressed to the Editor, Signed/ A.B.C. Re attempts of Governor Mouton and others to break down the Union Bank of Louisiana.
Proposals for Subscription to 7500 shares of the Capital Stock of "The Barrelville Mining Company" chartered by the State of Maryland in March 1844 &c.
The Age, New Orleans - Extract - Editorial comment on Speech of Senator Downs on the Union Bank of Louisiana.
Newspaper Extract - Money market - criticism of banks and banking affairs.
Newspaper Extract - For the Journal of Commerce. Suggestions to Cotton Operators.
Newspaper Extract - Official Report of the House of Representatives, Louisiana, Re Act to regulate the Currency, &c.
Newspaper Extract - Ohio State Stocks - Regulation for authenticating Certificates. Sgd/ Alfred Kelly, Comr. (Taken from 27/4/1842 M.)
Exports of Flour from United States 1800-1833.
Circular - Davis Brooks & Co. re. currency Question.
Miles' National Register (fragment) Extract from Beard of Public Works, Columbus, Ohio 8/1/1842.
Circular Letter marked Private & Confidential covering correspondence re affairs of Texas and Sgd/ J. Hamilton, A.T. Burnley, Commissioners.
Newspaper Extract - Statement of the Monthly receipts at the Treasury of Pennsylvania from December 1, 1843 to Nov. 30, 1844, inclusive. (Taken from 15/12/1844,O. Corr.)
American Republican and Baltimore Clipper, Extract - Resources of the State. (Taken from 30/5/1845 O. Corr.)
House of Delegates Maryland - Inaugural Address of Governor Pratt delivered in the Senate Chamber on taking the oaths of Office.
Statistics of Lowell Manufactures.

The Age, New Orleans - Extract - Editorial - Governor Mouton fails to refute the charges against him by publishing the documents prepared by the Board of Currency recommending repudiation - His action with regard to the Union Bank.
Newspaper Extract - The Crisis - Re suspension of specie payments.
United States Gazette. Pennsylvania State Debt.

Newspaper Extract - Law of the United States - Passed at Second Session of the 27th. Congress - An Act for the extension of the loan of eighteen hundred and forty-one, and for an addition of five million of dollars &c. Sgd/ John White, Speaker of the House of Reps. S.L. Southard, Presdt. Senate pro tempore John Tyler. (Taken from 1/5/1842 O.)

British Packet and Argentine News - Buenos Ayres - The decree sanctioned by the House of Representatives in its Session of the 20th May re. the agreement entered into with Mr. de Paleziens Falconnet in favour of the Bond-holders of the British Loan contracted in 1824, Sgd/ Miguel Garcia, Presdt. Lorenzo Torres, Secretary - Proposed British Hospital - Letter to the Editor Signed/ Wm. Brown. Merchant vessels in the Port of Buenos Ayres.

Advertiser & Patriot, Boston 11/7/1843 - Address of the Central Committee to the Whigs of Maryland. Sgd/ James Harwood, Geo. R. Richardson, Wm. H. Gatchell, Wm. Reynolds, Geo. M. Gill, Thomas Kelso, John Kennedy, James L. Ridgely, Chas. H. Pitts, John L. Carey, A.W. Bradford, James O. Law - also Editorial comments.
Circular - Ohio Life Insurance and Trust Company. Sgd/ M.T. Williams, President.

Newspaper Extract - Assumption of State Debts - Report of the Minority of the Committee of Ways and Means, United States House of Representatives on W.C. Johnson's proposal to issue two hundred millions of Stock to be given to the States.
Republican and Argus (Baltimore) - Editorial - Anti Repudiation Meeting - Resolution, &c. (Taken from 16/6/1843 O. Corr.)
Newspaper Extract (Illinois) Copy of Act to provide for paying a portion of the interest on the State Debt.
Newspaper Extract - Memorial to the Senate and House of Representative of the Commonwealth of Pennsylvania in general Assembly met - on the subject of the Public Debt.
Newspaper Clipping: Baltimore American - Burning of Ohio & railroad orders.
An Act providing for the voluntary liquidation of the Union Bank of Louisiana.
An Act to repeal a certain Act therein mentioned and to make further provision for enabling the Provincial Government to purchase the Stock held by private parties in the Welland Canal.

Louisiana Sessional Paper - No. 58 - An Act ammendatory of the several laws relative to the Citizens' Bank of Louisiana and consolidated Association of the Planters of Louisiana. (Taken from Corr. E.J.F.)
Cotton Crop of United States, Growth, Export, Consumption &c.
Newspaper Extract - Exports of Cotton from the Port of New York - and Ports cleared for.
The Journal of Commerce, 9/11/1844 - Extract - Letter to the Editors, dated at Boston 7/11/1844, on the Illinois Canal Loan. Sgd/ Wm. Sturgis, Abbott Lawrence, T.W. Ward. (Boston Committee)
Circular - (Mobile) - Merchants and Planters Prices Current. (Taken from 15/8/1843/ O. Corr.)

Newspaper Extract - Ordinance of the City Council of New Orleans - To fix the quota of the general debt to be paid during the year ending 1st May 1844, into the General Sinking Fund by the several Municipalities. (Taken from 15/7/1843 P. Corr.)
Circular, Canton, Signed/ Nye, Parkin & Co.
Resolutions adopted at the meeting of the Stockholders of the Consolidated Association of Planters of Louisiana on 21st. April 1845. (Taken from 3/5/1845 P. Corr.)

Newspaper Extract - The News for England. The difficulty in the way of the return of Mr. Everett, United States Minister, is the inability of the President to appoint a person who will accept the nomination when made - Discusses Oregon Question - (Taken from 16/5/1845 O. Corr.)
Circular - Cotton Crop of the United States - Statement and total amount of the Growth, Export, Consumption, &c.
The Public Works of Ohio - (Newspaper Clipping)
Advertiser and Patriot - Extract - Mexico and the French Minister. (Taken from 30/6/1845 O. Corr)
Newspaper Extract - Statement of the Returns made by the United States Bank of Pennsylvania to the Auditor General.
Printed Report of a Committee of the Merchants' Exchange Co. (Enclosure No. 1.) (Taken from 24/5/1843 Corr. P.W. & K. 1842-6)
Supplement to The Canton Register - East India Company and The Opium Trade (Geo. Hy. & Wm. Baring)
Pennsylvania House of Representatives No. 560 - An Act to reduce the State Debt.
The Journal of Commerce - Editorial - Bank of England.
Newspaper Extract - Cotton Reports, Florida, Charleston, New Orleans.

Newspaper Extract (Havana, Cuba) Re distruction by the negroes of the Arroyo Estate formerly belonging to Geo. Knight & Co. but through their failure passed into the possession of Baring Bros. (Taken from 11/5/1844 Corr. E.J.F.)
Memo of the Export of Teas to the United States since July 1st. 1843.
Pamphlet - Report of the Standing Committee on Finance on Senate Bill No. 31, providing for a cash valuation of property for taxation - (State of Ohio) - dated 17/2/1845.
Notice to subscribers to Illinois and Michigan Canal. Sgd/ W.H. Swift, President.

Parliamentary Returns relating to Wheat and Corn, &c. (Great Britain).

Liverpool - Statement of Stock & Cotton. Sgd/ Hollinshead, Tetley & Co.
Parliamentary Returns - Wheat (Canada).
Pamphlet - Report of the Standing Committee on Finance to whom was referred the Report of the Auditor of State of January 6, 1845 - State of Ohio, dated 7/2/1845
Maryland State Loan.
Bank Liquidating Law - Extract - Sections 28 & 29. (Taken from 30/4/1842 O.)
Canada - Condition of its finances.

Articles of Agreement concluded between Messrs. F. de Lizardi & Co., the Agents in London of the Government of the Republic of Mexico, duly authorized for that purpose, and the Committee of Spanish American Bond-holders. Sgd/ F.de Lizardi & Co. G.R. Robinson Ch. of the Committee.
General Assembly Maryland - The Treasurer's Annual Report - Sgd/D. Claude, Treasurer Maryland.
Prospectus of the Catholic Emigration Society.

Numerous Newspaper Clippings re finances of New York State and City - the greater part without date.

Circular - To the Holders of Illinois & Michigan Canal Bonds - Sgd/ Baring Bros. & Co., Magniac, Jardine and Co.,

Newspaper Extract - State Tax, Calvert County. (Md.) (Taken from 14/5/1843 O. Corr.)
Pamphlet - Inaugural address of the Governor of the State of Ohio delivered to both branches of the Legislature. Sgd/ Thos. Corwin.

Newspaper Extract - Letter addressed to an Editor regarding the finances of the State of Ohio. Sgd/ Jos. S. Lake - Commissioner Ohio Canal Fund.
Newspaper Extracts - New York Sale of Stocks, and short editorial comment on Governor Ford's Message re financial affairs of Illinois.
[Boston Post Extra] - The Exchequer & Currency Scheme - The Effects of Paper Money upon the Interests of the whole community. Signed/ H.
Newspaper Extract - the Money Market - Circular from State Treasurer of Pennsylvania, and comments upon it. (Taken from 31/5/1845 Corr. G.M. & Co.)

Pamphlet - Circular of the Illinois Commissioners, to the Holders of Illinois Stock.

Newspaper Extract - Letter addressed by John L. Carey to his Baltimore constituents explaining his part in connection with Legislative action with reference to the finance and credit of the State.
Petition to the General Assembly of Maryland - re Bonds of the State of Maryland. Sgd/ Baring Brothers & Co. by Louis McLane E.G. Oelrichs & Lurman.

Newspaper Extracts - Letter addressed to his constituents and others by J. Johnson in reply to Mr. Carey's letter to his constituents 16/3. (From Annapolis Republican) A second letter addressed to the Editors of the American defending Mr. Carey. Signed/ A State Faith Whig.

Statements re. Prices of Wheat and Flour and Provisions in the United States and also in North America, with tables of Imports and Exports of Wheat and Flour into and from the United States and into and from British North America.
